reviews.text:
This is a curious little station that is sadly let down by Southern Railways who just don't seem to be able to cope. 

We found the star here helpful and friendly but struggling with a system that just doesn't work properly.  The station has good facilities with food outlets offering a reasonable standard. 

It is very handy for visits to Lewes which has a wonderful old centre and castle.

We were distraught to find ourselves stranded at this lone train station in rural Great Britain. The lack of functioning telephone on the platform meant that we were unable to phone for help, should we have been attacked by one of the extremely dangerous seagulls that loiter around the premises. All in all, it was a traumatic experience, not to be repeated again.
Some useful stuff here and coffee shop both on concourse and platform. Always change here for Seaford.
Station facilities themselves are good and tend to be very clean. Staff mostly helpful and warm. Only downside is that delays happen far more often than I would like them to for certain lines.

Never a good experience being stuck here which is not unusual given Southern's record. Actual facilities aren't too awful. Some staff are quite helpful - eg most ticket sales staff, but not someone who works in the main announcements office called Ryan who is unhelpful and useless.
